t: Psalm 22
For the director of music. To the tune of “The Doe of the Morning.” A psalm of David.
My*pn God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why*ld are you so far from saving me, so*ld far from my cries of anguish?
My*ln God, I cry out by day, but you do not answer, by*ld night, but I find no rest.
Yet*pn you are enthroned as the Holy One; you*ld are the one Israel praises.
In*ln you our ancestors put their trust; they*ld trusted and you delivered them.
To*ln you they cried out and were saved; in*ld you they trusted and were not put to shame.
But*pn I am a worm and not a man, scorned*ld by everyone, despised by the people.
All*ln who see me mock me; they*ld hurl insults, shaking their heads.
“He*ln trusts in the Lord,”*s they say, “let*ld the Lord*s rescue him. Let*ln him deliver him, since*ld he delights in him.”
Yet*pn you brought me out of the womb; you*ld made me trust in you, even at my mother’s breast.
From*ln birth I was cast on you; from*ld my mother’s womb you have been my God.
Do*pn not be far from me, for*ld trouble is near and*ld there is no one to help.
Many*pn bulls surround me; strong*ld bulls of Bashan encircle me.
Roaring*ln lions that tear their prey open*ld their mouths wide against me.
I*ln am poured out like water, and*ld all my bones are out of joint. My*ln heart has turned to wax; it*ld has melted within me.
My*ln mouth is dried up like a potsherd, and*ld my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth; you*ld lay me in the dust of death.
Dogs*pn surround me, a*ld pack of villains encircles me; they*ld pierce my hands and my feet.
All*ln my bones are on display; people*ld stare and gloat over me.
They*ln divide my clothes among them and*ld cast lots for my garment.
But*pn you, Lord,*s do not be far from me. You*ld are my strength; come quickly to help me.
Deliver*ln me from the sword, my*ld precious life from the power of the dogs.
Rescue*ln me from the mouth of the lions; save*ld me from the horns of the wild oxen.
I*pn will declare your name to my people; in*ld the assembly I will praise you.
You*ln who fear the Lord,*s praise him! All*ld you descendants of Jacob, honor him! Revere*ld him, all you descendants of Israel!
For*ln he has not despised or scorned the*ld suffering of the afflicted one; he*ln has not hidden his face from him but*ld has listened to his cry for help.
From*pn you comes the theme of my praise in the great assembly; before*ld those who fear you I will fulfill my vows.
The*ln poor will eat and be satisfied; those*ld who seek the Lord*s will praise him— may*ld your hearts live forever!
All*pn the ends of the earth will*ld remember and turn to the Lord,*s and*ln all the families of the nations will*ld bow down before him,
for*ln dominion belongs to the Lord*s and*ld he rules over the nations.
All*pn the rich of the earth will feast and worship; all*ld who go down to the dust will kneel before him— those*ld who cannot keep themselves alive.
Posterity*ln will serve him; future*ld generations will be told about the Lord.
They*ln will proclaim his righteousness, declaring*ld to a people yet unborn: He*ld has done it!
